title.narrative: COVID-19 risks and impact reduction; efforts on infection prevention and control in Khartoum State

description.narrative: This a COVID-19 support project in Khartoum, the project seeks to support concerted effort to contain the pandemic in Khartoum state in some of the poor peri-urban areas where CAFOD has been supporting communities in the last two years. The overall goal of the project is to contribute to the national response on COVID 19 outbreak, supporting effective risk communication and community engagement and alleviating suffering of vulnerable population in the Suburbs of Khartoum. Target people and communities. 180 families to be provided with Food Baskets and over 10,000 people reached with information on prevention of COVID-19 through mass media. The project duration is 3 months starting 15th May - 15th August 2020. Project Outputs: Number of types of COVID-19 prevention messages prepared and approved. Number of awareness messaging done – by count of the trips of pick up tract fitted with loudspeakers. Number of food and essential items sellers identified Number of Food baskets vouchers prepared and distributed for vulnerable HHs in Umbanda localities. Project Activities: Mapping out a zoning intervention location, and households for support with food vouchers Preparation and printing of COVID-19 prevention message in local languages- Print IEC mass awareness 4,000 IEC and distribute it to the target locations in the target areas (public transportation locations, markets, malls, bakeries, fuel stations and health centers Undertake Health and hygiene promotion activities in Umbanda localities Identification and signing agreements with at least 10 food and essential items sellers in Umbanda locality Printing of Food Vouchers (security tight) for 200 HHs (each vulnerable family will receive vouchers worth 4,000 SDG). SIDO Khartoum programme is first support were have for the partner despite having worked with the partner in other states for a long period.
